# OpenBB Docs - cli

## Docs

- [Commands And Arguments](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/commands-and-arguments): This page explains how to enter commands and arguments into the OpenBB Platform CLI.
- [Configuration & Settings](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/configuration): This documentation page details the various settings and feature flags used to customize the OpenBB Platform CLI.
- [Data Sources](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/data-sources): This page explains how to select a provider for any specific command, and set a default source for a route.
- [Introduction](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/index): The OpenBB Platform CLI is a command line interface wrapping the OpenBB Platform. It offers a convenient way to interact with the Platform and its extensions, as well as automate data collection via OpenBB Routine Scripts. No experience with Python, or other programming languages, is required.
- [Installation](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/installation): This page provides installation instructions for the OpenBB Platform CLI.
- [Interactive Charts](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/interactive-charts): This page provides a detailed explanation of the OpenBB Interactive Charts. Understand various capabilities including annotation, color modification, drawing tools, data export, and supplementary data overlay.
- [Interactive Tables](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/interactive-tables): This page explains how to navigate and utilize OpenBB's interactive tables. Understand how to sort and filter columns, hide or remove columns, select number of rows per page, freeze index and column headers, and export the data.
- [OpenBBUserData Folder](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/openbbuserdata): The OpenBBUserData folder is where exports, routines, and other user-related content is saved and stored. Its default location is the home of the system user account.
- [Quick Start](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/quickstart): This page is a quick start guide for the OpenBB Platform CLI.
- [Advanced Routines](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/routines/advanced-routines): This page provides guidance on creating and running advanced workflows in the OpenBB Platform CLI by introducing variables and arguments for routines. It explains input variables, relative time keyword variables, internal script variables and creating loops for batch execution.
- [Routines](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/routines/index): <NewReferenceCard
- [Introduction to Routines](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/routines/introduction-to-routines): The page provides a detailed introduction to OpenBB Routines, which allow users to automate processes and repetitive tasks in financial analysis and data collection. It explains conventions, basic scripts, routine execution, and guides users on getting started with an example.
- [Routine Macro Recorder](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/routines/routine-macro-recorder): Learn how to use the macro recorder in OpenBB to start saving commands and automate common tasks with scripts. This page guides you through the process of recording, saving, and accessing your recorded routines.
- [Structure and Navigation](https://docs.openbb.co/cli/structure-and-navigation): This page describes the layout and structure of the OpenBB Platform CLI, as well as how to navigate it.
